page.title: 05The Great Tweed Raft Race
page.content: Every year in Kelso there is a Raft Race on the River{Tweed.}The race is six miles long and it starts in Kelso and ends in England which is out of our block on our map. There are two separate races; the{Fancy Dress race and the{Speed race.}The fancy dress rafts go off first because they are slow. It takes at least three hours for all the rafts to come down the Tweed. Lots and lots of people from all over Britain take part every year. The fancy dress rafts are often very funny. Some of the best ones have been elephants, Donald Duck and once there was even a 25 metre long battleship! Thousands of people gather every year along the banks of the Tweed to watch the race. A lot of factories in Kelso enter rafts for the race. The Kelso Laddies Association and the Round Table organise the raft race.
